summary.long: Joel is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The word of the Lord that came to Joel, the son of Pethuel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear this, O elders,
And listen, all inhabitants of the land.
Has anything like this happened in your days
Or in your fathers’ days?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tell your sons about it,
And let your sons tell their sons,
And their sons the next generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, drunkards, and weep;
And wail, all you wine drinkers,
On account of the sweet wine
That is cut off from your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a nation has invaded my land,
Mighty and without number;
Its teeth are the teeth of a lion,
And it has the fangs of a lioness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It has made my vine a waste
And my fig tree splinters.
It has stripped them bare and cast them away;
Their branches have become white.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wail like a virgin girded with sackcloth
For the bridegroom of her youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The grain offering and the drink offering are cut off
From the house of the Lord.
The priests mourn,
The ministers of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The field is ruined,
The land mourns;
For the grain is ruined,
The new wine dries up,
Fresh oil fails.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be ashamed, O farmers,
Wail, O vinedressers,
For the wheat and the barley;
Because the harvest of the field is destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The vine dries up
And the fig tree fails;
The pomegranate, the palm also, and the apple tree,
All the trees of the field dry up.
Indeed, rejoicing dries up
From the sons of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gird yourselves with sackcloth
And lament, O priests;
Wail, O ministers of the altar!
Come, spend the night in sackcloth
O ministers of my God,
For the grain offering and the drink offering
Are withheld from the house of your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consecrate a fast,
Proclaim a solemn assembly;
Gather the elders
And all the inhabitants of the land
To the house of the Lord your God,
And cry out to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Alas for the day!
For the day of the Lord is near,
And it will come as destruction from the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has not food been cut off before our eyes,
Gladness and joy from the house of our God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The seeds shrivel under their clods;
The storehouses are desolate,
The barns are torn down,
For the grain is dried up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How the beasts groan!
The herds of cattle wander aimlessly
Because there is no pasture for them;
Even the flocks of sheep suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Blow a trumpet in Zion,
And sound an alarm on My holy mountain!
Let all the inhabitants of the land tremble,
For the day of the Lord is coming;
Surely it is near,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A day of darkness and gloom,
A day of clouds and thick darkness.
As the dawn is spread over the mountains,
So there is a great and mighty people;
There has never been anything like it,
Nor will there be again after it
To the years of many generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fire consumes before them
And behind them a flame burns.
The land is like the garden of Eden before them
But a desolate wilderness behind them,
And nothing at all escapes them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their appearance is like the appearance of horses;
And like war horses, so they run.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With a noise as of chariots
They leap on the tops of the mountains,
Like the crackling of a flame of fire consuming the stubble,
Like a mighty people arranged for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before them the people are in anguish;
All faces turn pale.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They run like mighty men,
They climb the wall like soldiers;
And they each march in line,
Nor do they deviate from their paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They do not crowd each other,
They march everyone in his path;
When they burst through the defenses,
They do not break ranks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They rush on the city,
They run on the wall;
They climb into the houses,
They enter through the windows like a thief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before them the earth quakes,
The heavens tremble,
The sun and the moon grow dark
And the stars lose their brightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord utters His voice before His army;
Surely His camp is very great,
For strong is he who carries out His word.
The day of the Lord is indeed great and very awesome,
And who can endure it?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And rend your heart and not your garments.”
Now return to the Lord your God,
For He is gracious and compassionate,
Slow to anger, abounding in lovingkindness
And relenting of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who knows whether He will not turn and relent
And leave a blessing behind Him,
Even a grain offering and a drink offering
For the Lord your God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blow a trumpet in Zion,
Consecrate a fast, proclaim a solemn assembly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gather the people, sanctify the congregation,
Assemble the elders,
Gather the children and the nursing infants.
Let the bridegroom come out of his room
And the bride out of her bridal chamber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the priests, the Lord’s ministers,
Weep between the porch and the altar,
And let them say, “Spare Your people, O Lord,
And do not make Your inheritance a reproach,
A byword among the nations.
Why should they among the peoples say,
‘Where is their God?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord will be zealous for His land
And will have pity on His people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will answer and say to His people,
“Behold, I am going to send you grain, new wine and oil,
And you will be satisfied in full with them;
And I will never again make you a reproach among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But I will remove the northern army far from you,
And I will drive it into a parched and desolate land,
And its vanguard into the eastern sea,
And its rear guard into the western sea.
And its stench will arise and its foul smell will come up,
For it has done great things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not fear, O land, rejoice and be glad,
For the Lord has done great things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not fear, beasts of the field,
For the pastures of the wilderness have turned green,
For the tree has borne its fruit,
The fig tree and the vine have yielded in full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So rejoice, O sons of Zion,
And be glad in the Lord your God;
For He has given you the early rain for your vindication.
And He has poured down for you the rain,
The early and latter rain as before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The threshing floors will be full of grain,
And the vats will overflow with the new wine and oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then I will make up to you for the years
That the swarming locust has eaten,
The creeping locust, the stripping locust and the gnawing locust,
My great army which I sent among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You will have plenty to eat and be satisfied
And praise the name of the Lord your God,
Who has dealt wondrously with you;
Then My people will never be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Thus you will know that I am in the midst of Israel,
And that I am the Lord your God,
And there is no other;
And My people will never be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“It will come about after this
That I will pour out My Spirit on all mankind;
And your sons and daughters will prophesy,
Your old men will dream dreams,
Your young men will see visions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Even on the male and female servants
I will pour out My Spirit in those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will display wonders in the sky and on the earth,
Blood, fire and columns of smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The sun will be turned into darkness
And the moon into blood
Before the great and awesome day of the Lord comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And it will come about that whoever calls on the name of the Lord
Will be delivered;
For on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem
There will be those who escape,
As the Lord has said,
Even among the survivors whom the Lord calls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For behold, in those days and at that time,
When I restore the fortunes of Judah and Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will gather all the nations
And bring them down to the valley of Jehoshaphat.
Then I will enter into judgment with them there
On behalf of My people and My inheritance, Israel,
Whom they have scattered among the nations;
And they have divided up My land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They have also cast lots for My people,
Traded a boy for a harlot
And sold a girl for wine that they may drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, what are you to Me, O Tyre, Sidon and all the regions of Philistia? Are you rendering Me a recompense? But if you do recompense Me, swiftly and speedily I will return your recompense on your head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since you have taken My silver and My gold, brought My precious treasures to your temples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sold the sons of Judah and Jerusalem to the Greeks in order to remove them far from their territory,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: behold, I am going to arouse them from the place where you have sold them, and return your recompense on your head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also I will sell your sons and your daughters into the hand of the sons of Judah, and they will sell them to the Sabeans, to a distant nation,” for the Lord has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Proclaim this among the nations:
Prepare a war; rouse the mighty men!
Let all the soldiers draw near, let them come up!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hasten and come, all you surrounding nations,
And gather yourselves there.
Bring down, O Lord, Your mighty ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the nations be aroused
And come up to the valley of Jehoshaphat,
For there I will sit to judge
All the surrounding nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision!
For the day of the Lord is near in the valley of decision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun and moon grow dark
And the stars lose their brightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord roars from Zion
And utters His voice from Jerusalem,
And the heavens and the earth tremble.
But the Lord is a refuge for His people
And a stronghold to the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will know that I am the Lord your God,
Dwelling in Zion, My holy mountain.
So Jerusalem will be holy,
And strangers will pass through it no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And in that day
The mountains will drip with sweet wine,
And the hills will flow with milk,
And all the brooks of Judah will flow with water;
And a spring will go out from the house of the Lord
To water the valley of Shittim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Egypt will become a waste,
And Edom will become a desolate wilderness,
Because of the violence done to the sons of Judah,
In whose land they have shed innocent blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Judah will be inhabited forever
And Jerusalem for all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will avenge their blood which I have not avenged,
For the Lord dwells in Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
